intro: Phyteuma ellipticifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces cylindrical, blue-green stems with lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Phyteuma ellipticifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
